definition.name: RadioGroup
definition.purpose: Provides a group of radio buttons for selecting a single option from a set.
definition.description: A styled wrapper around Radix UI's RadioGroupPrimitive.Root, allowing users to select one option from a group. It supports custom class names and passes all props to the underlying primitive.

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the radio group container.

initial.data: No option selected by default unless a value is provided.

visible: A group of radio buttons arranged in a grid with spacing.
enabled: User can select one radio button at a time.

when.description: User clicks on a radio button.

from.state: No option or another option selected

to.state: The clicked radio button is selected

effects: The selected value changes and the UI updates to reflect the new selection.

definition.visualLayout: A grid layout with gap between radio buttons, styled with rounded borders and focus/disabled states.
definition.implementationNotes: Uses Radix UI's RadioGroupPrimitive.Root for accessibility and state management. Styling is applied via Tailwind CSS and the cn utility.

definition.name: RadioGroupItem
definition.purpose: Represents a single radio button item within a RadioGroup.
definition.description: A styled wrapper around Radix UI's RadioGroupPrimitive.Item, providing a custom indicator and visual feedback for selection, focus, and disabled states.

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the radio item.

visible: A circular radio button with border and indicator.
enabled: User can select the radio button unless disabled.

when.description: User clicks or focuses the radio button.

effects: The indicator appears when selected. Focus and disabled styles are applied as appropriate.

definition.visualLayout: A small, circular button with a border. When selected, a filled circle indicator appears in the center.
definition.implementationNotes: Uses Radix UI's RadioGroupPrimitive.Item and Indicator for accessibility and state. The indicator uses the CircleIcon from lucide-react for a custom look.
